original_title: MEPA to reassess damage caused by X-Press Pearl disaster
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Marine Environment Protection Authority (MEPA) said measures have been taken to reassess the damage caused by the X-Press Pearl vessel that caught fire in the Sea of Sri Lanka.
MEPA Chairman Attorney Asela B. Rekawa said the report is being formulated based on the directives of the Attorney General's Department.
He said the damage caused to Sri Lanka by the X-Press Pearl disaster is being assessed till the period ending on the 30th of April of this year.
The damage caused to the Sea of Sri Lanka by the X-Press Pearl disaster has only been assessed till the 30th of November, 2022.
MEPA said the amount of nearly 6.5 billion dollars, which is currently estimated as the full compensation for damages, may increase further following the new assessment.

Sri Lanka recently filed a lawsuit before a Singapore court demanding compensation for the environmental damage caused by the X-Press Pearl disaster and the case is scheduled to be called once again on Monday (15).
